p: In December 2019, a new Coronavirus, first called 2019-nCov and then SARS-CoV-2 for severe acute respiratory syndrome Coronavirus 2, was identified in Wuhan, China ( 3). SARS-CoV-2 spreads very efficiently, causing the current COVID-19 (Coronavirus Disease 2019) pandemic, that by mid-May 2020 has already killed more than 300,000 people all over the world.
